timeline.bodyText:
The size check is redundant here.
This will lead to more alerts being raised than before (assuming more than one context) and always with the details of the first context. Do you meant to add a break?
timeline.author: thc202

replies.bodyText: Now I added size check before the for loop. I think this will not raise more alerts if there are more than one context.
replies.author: theamanrawat

replies.bodyText: It will still raise them, it would have to break the loop to just raise once (technically the size check is no longer needed with the use of the loop).
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText: Also, worth trying to add a test for this case.
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText: Here context is the reflection of payload in HTML right?
replies.author: theamanrawat

replies.bodyText: With or without size check,  It will not give multiple alerts even If there are more than one context. However size check is not required so I will remove it.
replies.author: theamanrawat

replies.bodyText: You mean with contexts2 having size more than 1?
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText: And both having no surrounding quote?
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText: So, the break was added, that makes more sense.
replies.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: This could be removed, or moved to the end of the file.
